title: 108_hr4516
content:
The Act may be cited as the "Department of Energy High-End Computing Revitalization Act of 2004". It includes definitions for various terms used in the Act. The Act defines key terms such as "Center," "High-end computing system," "Leadership System," "Institution of higher education," and "Secretary." The Act defines key terms related to high-end computing systems and institutions of higher education. Energy, through the Director of the Office of Science, plays a significant role in this. The Department of Energy High-End Computing Research and Development Program is established. The Secretary shall conduct research and development to advance high-end computing systems, support individual and multidisciplinary teams, research multiple architectures, develop software, and provide sustained access for the research community. The Secretary conducts research and development to advance high-end computing systems, support research teams, develop software, provide sustained access for the research community, support technology transfer, and coordinate activities with relevant industry and federal agencies. The Secretary establishes Leadership Systems facilities for advanced research and development in high-end computing, providing access to researchers from various institutions. Additionally, a High-End Software Development Center is established as part of the program. The Secretary establishes a High-End Software Development Center to focus on developing, testing, and supporting algorithms, programming environments, and operating systems for high-end computing systems. The Center will have a mix of permanent and rotating staff from other institutions and industry to promote research coordination and technology transfer. The selection of the Center will be through a competitive proposal process administered by the Secretary. Authorization of appropriations for high-end computing:
- $50,000,000 for fiscal year 2005
- $55,000,000 for fiscal year 2006
- $60,000,000 for fiscal year 2007
